bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John R. Taylor, February 26, 1942

div1.p: Hench informs Taylor that he was aware Taylor is American, not English.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John R. Taylor, February 26, 1942
div1.opener:
Y F.
February 26, 1942
Mr. John R. Taylor
548 Grand Ave.
Upper Darby, Pennsylvania
My dear Mr. Taylor:
div1.p:
Thank you indeed for the directions on how
to reach your home. I have no immediate plans for
coming East but am glad to have this information and
will let you know far enough ahead of time when we do
come.

I still haven't had a chance to get my list
of questions together. It may be a few weeks yet but I
am anxious to get them to you for your further help.

I knew you were American, not English, as I
found in the Archives Building in Washington a letter from
Guiteras to somebody in Washington asking that this correc-
tion be made. I have a copy of the letter.

Thank you for letting me keep the films
temporarily.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
